snippet: Spencer Bachus, the Alabama Republican who is chairman of the House Financial Services Committee, said that he expected to be cleared of wrongdoing by the Office of Congressional Ethics.
abstract: Alabama Rep Spencer Bachus, Republican chairman of the House Financial Services Committee, says he expects to be cleared of wrongdoing in inquiry by the Office of Congressional Ethics into possible violations of insider-trading laws.

byline.original: By JENNIFER STEINHAUER and ERIC LIPTON

lead_paragraph: Spencer Bachus, the Alabama Republican who is chairman of the House Financial Services Committee, said that he expected to be cleared of wrongdoing by the Office of Congressional Ethics.

headline.seo: Rep. Spencer Bachus Says Trading Inquiry Will Clear Him
headline.main: Chairman of House Financial Panel Expects ‘Full Exoneration’ in Trading Inquiry
headline.print_headline: Chairman of House Financial Panel Expects ‘Full Exoneration’ in Trading Inquiry
